plugins.name: Height
plugins.description:
The Height plugin for Figma combines Height's powerful project management capabilities with Figma's design features.

As you work in Figma, keep your teammates up-to-date in Height by:

  • Posting screenshot updates from Figma files to Height tasks.
  • Seeing previews of Figma designs in Height when you post a link to any Figma file in a task.
  • Centralizing conversation about projects with cross-posted comments from Figma to Height.
  • Creating new tasks in Height to track todos and follow-ups right from Figma.
  • Updating the status of tasks in Height straight from Figma.

Keep everyone in the loop, without leaving Figma.


https://height.app/
plugins.tagline: Automatically keep your tasks up-to-date by sharing mockups and cross-posted comments from Figma

plugins.name: Quick scale
plugins.description:
A simple plugin to proportionally scale any selected elements by a set amount. No popup – just choose your scaling factor or device size and voilà.


Assigning keyboard shortcuts is on you but the individual menu commands make that easy as pie. If you’ve not done this before Apple have instructions for setting shortcuts on a mac.


Try typing your scaling factor or device width into the ⌘k actions menu for a good time!
plugins.tagline: Proportionally scale objects with easy keyboard commands

122911.name: Quick scale
122911.description:
A simple plugin to proportionally scale any selected elements by a set amount. No popup – just choose your scaling factor or device size and voilà.


Assigning keyboard shortcuts is on you but the individual menu commands make that easy as pie. If you’ve not done this before Apple have instructions for setting shortcuts on a mac.


Try typing your scaling factor or device width into the ⌘k actions menu for a good time!
122911.release_notes: Added scaling proportionally to specific phone widths and placed less common items into submenus
122911.tagline: Proportionally scale objects with easy keyboard commands

plugins.name: Color Extract
plugins.description:
Based on the standards of material design, the palette library extracts commonly used color profiles from an image. The palette library attempts to extract the following six color profiles:

• Light Vibrant
• Vibrant
• Dark Vibrant
• Light Muted
• Muted
• Dark Muted

Learn more  — https://developer.android.com/training/material/palette-colors#extract-color-profiles

Credits 
https://github.com/akfish/node-vibrant

plugins.name: Colour Palette Creator
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you select a base colour to generate different shades for use in your project. These colours are also synced up to the local variables inside Figma.


To get started:

  1. Set up a collection for your colours named 'Primitives : Colours'. The plugin needs this collection to work!
plugins.tagline: A plugin to create colour paletes for your Figma projects.

96975.tagline: A plugin to create colour paletes for your Figma projects.

plugins.name: Brainstorm
plugins.description:
The goal in Context: The UX Designer wants to create an efficient and effective copywriting process in Figma to improve the overall user experience of the product.

Main Flow:

The UX Designer launches Figma and selects a design project.

The Designer opens the Brainstorm Plugin

The Designer inputs the current text in the text element.

AI generates a list of copywriting suggestions based on the input.

The Designer selects the suggested copy that best fits the design and updates the text element in Figma.

The Designer continues to improve the copywriting of the design project by repeating steps 2-6.
plugins.tagline: Generate Content on the Go with AI

122689.name: Brainstorm
122689.description:
The goal in Context: The UX Designer wants to create an efficient and effective copywriting process in Figma to improve the overall user experience of the product.

Main Flow:

The UX Designer launches Figma and selects a design project.

The Designer opens the Brainstorm Plugin

The Designer inputs the current text in the text element.

AI generates a list of copywriting suggestions based on the input.

The Designer selects the suggested copy that best fits the design and updates the text element in Figma.

The Designer continues to improve the copywriting of the design project by repeating steps 2-6.

manifest.name: Brainstorm - Generate Content on the Go

122689.tagline: Generate Content on the Go with AI

plugins.name: Расческа
plugins.description:
Плагин для UX-редакторов, которые подготавливают тексты для разработки. Выделите нужную зону и запустите плагин, чтобы:

  1. проставить неразрывные пробелы около коротких русских слов, чисел и специальных знаков;
  2. превратить отдельно стоящие дефисы (-) в тире (—);
  3. превратить дефисы внутри слов (-) в неразрывные дефисы (‑).


Все функции плагина. Если вам чего-то не хватает, заведите Issue (кнопка New issue) и опишите, что хотите.


Если вам очень помогает плагин, и вы в восторге от него, можете угостить меня кофе 😊
plugins.tagline: Подготовьте тексты перед разработкой: неразрывные пробелы и замена дефисов где надо

135302.name: Расческа
135302.description:
Плагин для UX-редакторов, которые подготавливают тексты для разработки. Выделите нужную зону и запустите плагин, чтобы:

  1. проставить неразрывные пробелы около коротких русских слов, чисел и специальных знаков;
  2. превратить отдельно стоящие дефисы (-) в тире (—);
  3. превратить дефисы внутри слов (-) в неразрывные дефисы (‑).


Все функции плагина. Если вам чего-то не хватает, заведите Issue (кнопка New issue) и опишите, что хотите.


Если вам очень помогает плагин, и вы в восторге от него, можете угостить меня кофе 😊
135302.tagline: Подготовьте тексты перед разработкой: неразрывные пробелы и замена дефисов где надо

plugins.name: Nester
plugins.description:
Nester will nest any object that resides above (but not inside) a top-level frame/artboard. 

If you have ever made a presentation or exported an asset only to find something you thought you put inside a frame, actually isn't, Nester will fix this automatically.

How to use:
Run Nester and it will detect if any object sits completely above another frame, and nest it inside. If the object overlaps the bounds of the frame and is not completely within a frame's bounds, it will leave the object as is.

2434.name: Nester
2434.description:
Nester will nest any object that resides above (but not inside) a top-level frame/artboard. 

If you have ever made a presentation or exported an asset only to find something you thought you put inside a frame, actually isn't, Nester will fix this automatically.

How to use:
Run Nester and it will detect if any object sits completely above another frame, and nest it inside. If the object overlaps the bounds of the frame and is not completely within a frame's bounds, it will leave the object as is.

plugins.name: Figma Helpers
plugins.description:
Figma Helpers is a set of automated actions that speed up and help manage your workflow.


Count and go to instances of a component

Find the number of instances for any component and traverse to each instance found on your current page.


Make working with text easier

Select a text layer and separate it into individual text layers or export all the text within a group or component.


Organize and manage your page layers

Sort layers by name or name and type as well as collapse to your top-level layer to navigate your file easier.


Update AutoLayout properties for all children at once

Update the Auto Layout properties of all immediate children to either Fill or Fixed / Hug. Works for both height and width properties.


Reach out to me on Twitter if you have feedback or want me to add new actions.
plugins.tagline: Automated actions that speed up and help manage your workflow!

84485.name: Figma Helpers
84485.description:

Make working with text easier

Organize and manage your page layers

Sort layers by name or name and type as well as collapse to your top-level layer to navigate your file easier.


Update AutoLayout properties for all children at once

Update the Auto Layout properties of all immediate children to either Fill or Fixed / Hug. Works for both height and width properties.


Reach out to me on Twitter if you have feedback or want me to add new actions.
84485.tagline: Automated actions that speed up and help manage your workflow!

plugins.name: Text Dash
plugins.description:
Edit all the text layers in your selection in one place.

选中一次，编辑所有文字。


Now even in dark mode of Figma.

现已支持 Figma 暗色模式。


Intro

Text Dash will show all the text layers inside as you select any layers, and you can edit them quickly, saving you from keeping clicking layers to edit tons of text layers.


介绍

在选中图层的时候，Text Dash 会显示出内部所有的文本图层的文字内容。在 Text Dash 内部编辑文本时，改动会实时同步到文本图层当中。


How to Use

  1. open the Text Dash
  2. select any layers, including groups, frames, components, text layers, etc
  3. edit them as you see


如何使用

  1. 打开 Text Dash 插件
  2. 选中图层（包括 group 和 frame 等，也支持图层多选）
  3. 修改 Text Dash 中展示的文本，改动会实时同步到文本图层中


Roadmap

  1. Sort inputs according to geometry position. ✅
  2. Find and Replace (tell me if you want it).
  3. Add prefix or suffix in once.


路线图

  1. 根据图层位置排布输入框顺序✅
  2. 查找替换功能
  3. 批量增加前缀后缀功能


Contact

📬 Mail: tanshow@zju.edu.cn





﻿
plugins.tagline: text

plugins.name: Auto Rename Frames with AI Suggestions
plugins.description:
Auto Rename helps you easily rename or label frames you select in bulk.


With this tool, you can:

  1. Drag a region to select frames you want to rename in bulk.
  2. Select frames based on its properties, such as Mobile, Desktop or Interactive Frames.
  3. Get smart AI** suggested frame names. (new!)
  4. Automatically add a Label, or rename selected frames.


Auto Frame Label is meant to help designers reduce the time needed to organise Figma frames in large files. With that, it allows designers to fully focus on our craft.


**This particular AI uses a library to comprehend what the frames are about, and generates a few options for you to choose from. It might not always work, but serves as a fast way to rename contextually.


How to use:

  1. Open plugin on Figma or Figjam.
  2. Choose the type of method to select frames.
  3. Select frames.
  4. Add Labels or Rename.


by Yuan Jie

accepted.name: Yuan Jie
accepted.description:
Product Designer/Developer

Making simple tools to help designers design more efficiently. In particular, tools to help visualise big amount of data.

plugins.tagline: Rename or label frames you select in bulk, with AI suggestions.

plugins.name: BrandIcon Generator
plugins.description:
BrandIcon Generator is a Figma plugin designed to simplify your branding process. Created by Fluidesigns, a branding and UI/UX agency, this tool reflects our understanding of efficient brand asset management.


Key Features:

* Export in PNG, JPG, and SVG formats

* Automatically generate sizes from 48x48 to 1024x1024

* Create social media-ready versions for Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn

* Generate favicons instantly

* Maintain proportional scaling and padding across all sizes

* Batch export all variations in one go


Perfect for designers, brand managers, and marketing teams, BrandIcon Generator saves hours of manual work and ensures consistency across all your brand assets. Whether you're working on a new brand identity or managing existing ones, this plugin streamlines your workflow, allowing you to focus on what matters most – creating impactful designs.


Developed with attention to detail and user experience, BrandIcon Generator reflects Fluidesigns' commitment to efficient and effective branding solutions.


For feedback or inquiries: enquiry@fluidesigns.in
plugins.tagline: Download Your Logo Instantly in Multiple Sizes and Formats

plugins.name: Planet
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin for generating 3D-style, vector-based planets and terrain maps.

Design unique planets with adjustable sliders and randomization options. Save your favorite designs as reusable presets or explore default ones. Switch to map mode to create 2D terrain maps and apply them to your planet in planet mode.


🪐 Features 🪐

  1. Real-time adjustments with live preview: See your changes instantly.
  2. Custom presets: Save and manage your designs for quick reuse.
  3. Selective randomization: Toggle random variations on specific parameters.
  4. Detailed sliders: Fine-tune every aspect of your planet or map.
  5. Map mode: Generate 2D terrain maps and integrate them into your planet designs.


Tips & Tricks

🎨 Customizing colors

Use Figma's "Selection colors" feature in the properties panel to easily adjust the colors of your vector art.


🕔 Performance optimization

Lower the "Density" or raise the "Water Level" to improve performance on slower devices. High dot density can slow down rendering.


🖼️ Page management

Avoid using more than a few vector planets on the same page. If needed, resize and export them as PNGs to save resources.


⚡ Optimizing for slow CPUs

Minimize rendered dots and avoid using maximum settings on less powerful machines. At its peak, the plugin may generate up to 10,000 vector objects per frame.
plugins.tagline: Create unique vector planets, spheres and terrain maps in Figma

117586.name: Planet
117586.description:
A Figma plugin for generating 3D-style, vector-based planets and terrain maps.

Design unique planets with adjustable sliders and randomization options. Save your favorite designs as reusable presets or explore default ones. Switch to map mode to create 2D terrain maps and apply them to your planet in planet mode.


🪐 Features 🪐

  1. Real-time adjustments with live preview: See your changes instantly.
  2. Custom presets: Save and manage your designs for quick reuse.
  3. Selective randomization: Toggle random variations on specific parameters.
  4. Detailed sliders: Fine-tune every aspect of your planet or map.
  5. Map mode: Generate 2D terrain maps and integrate them into your planet designs.


Tips & Tricks

🎨 Customizing colors

Use Figma's "Selection colors" feature in the properties panel to easily adjust the colors of your vector art.


🕔 Performance optimization

Lower the "Density" or raise the "Water Level" to improve performance on slower devices. High dot density can slow down rendering.


🖼️ Page management

Avoid using more than a few vector planets on the same page. If needed, resize and export them as PNGs to save resources.


⚡ Optimizing for slow CPUs

Minimize rendered dots and avoid using maximum settings on less powerful machines. At its peak, the plugin may generate up to 10,000 vector objects per frame.
117586.release_notes: The Earth map added by default on startup.
117586.tagline: Create unique vector planets, spheres and terrain maps in Figma

plugins.name: Swatch This
plugins.description:
Bring your broken, imported, or otherwise orphaned colours back into the warm embrace of your colour system with the 1-click colour linker!


  • Connects unlinked colours to exact-match local colour styles
  • Convenient for vector illustrations imported from other programs or linking otherwise unlinked-but-identical colours
  • Works with solid fills, strokes, and type


Note: If you want to link to globally defined styles, you will need to run the plugin in the file (or duplicate of the file) where you publish your global styles from, as they will be local to that file.

accepted.name: Frank
accepted.description: digital handyman and collector of curiosities.

plugins.tagline: 1-click-link to local colour styles

plugins.name: AI Text
plugins.description:
Through the power of AI, populate your designs with realistic content to supercharge your workflow.


✓ Intelligent Fill: Generate realistic placeholder content with a single click based on simple prompts, boosting productivity.

✓ Batch Replacement: Quickly and efficiently replace text in bulk, without disrupting the text order in layers.

✓ Ready to Use: Comes preloaded with various AI models. No need for API registration, credit card binding, or complex configurations.

✓ Pay-as-You-Go: Say goodbye to traditional subscription plans — redeemed sugar can be used anytime within a year.

✓ More Features: Based on user feedback, we’ll continuously add practical AI features. Stay tuned!


We look forward to your feedback and suggestions!

If you have innovative ideas or report any issues, please feel free to contact us!


----------------------


借助 AI 的力量，在 Figma 一键填充真实的文字内容，全面增强您的设计工作流程。


✓ 智能填充：根据简单的提示，一键生成真实的占位内容，解放生产力

✓ 批量替换：快速、批量的替换文本内容，不会打乱图层中的文本顺序

✓ 开箱即用：内置多种 AI 大模型，不需要再绑卡申请 API 并配置魔法网络

✓ 按量付费：摒弃传统订阅模式，兑换的方糖可在一年内任意使用

111855.description:
Through the power of AI, populate your designs with realistic content to supercharge your workflow.


✓ Intelligent Fill: Generate realistic placeholder content with a single click based on simple prompts, boosting productivity.

✓ Batch Replacement: Quickly and efficiently replace text in bulk, without disrupting the text order in layers.

✓ Ready to Use: Comes preloaded with various AI models. No need for API registration, credit card binding, or complex configurations.

✓ Pay-as-You-Go: Say goodbye to traditional subscription plans — redeemed sugar can be used anytime within a year.

✓ More Features: Based on user feedback, we’ll continuously add practical AI features. Stay tuned!


We look forward to your feedback and suggestions!

If you have innovative ideas or report any issues, please feel free to contact us!


----------------------

plugins.name: Flows Alicorp
plugins.description:
Español

¡Presentamos nuestro nuevo plugin de Figma diseñado por el equipo de Experience Design de Alicorp, perfecto para darle vida a tus diagramas y flujos de trabajo con flechas personalizables!


Con nuestro plugin, crear conexiones visuales entre tus ideas nunca ha sido tan fácil ni tan divertido. Elige entre líneas curvas, rectas o directas y personaliza cada detalle: desde el color y el grosor hasta la transparencia y el estilo de la línea, ya sea continua o punteada. ¿Necesitas flechas con un toque especial? Ajusta las cabezas de las flechas a tu gusto y añade cajas de texto que se integran perfectamente con el diseño de la línea.


Además, nuestro plugin te permite trabajar como más te convenga: puedes generar flechas automáticamente al seleccionar elementos, crearlas manualmente o modificar tus flechas existentes con un simple "Reiniciar". Todo está diseñado para que tu proceso de diseño sea lo más fluido posible.


¡Dale un vistazo y descubre cómo este plugin puede mejorar tu flujo de trabajo en Figma! ¡Te invitamos a probarlo y llevar tus diseños al siguiente nivel! 🚀


English

Introducing our new Figma plugin, crafted by the Experience Design team at Alicorp, perfect for bringing your diagrams and workflows to life with customizable arrows!


With our plugin, creating visual connections between your ideas has never been easier or more enjoyable. Choose from curved, straight, or direct lines and customize every detail: from color and thickness to transparency and line style, whether continuous or dashed. Need arrows with a unique touch? Adjust the arrowheads to your liking and add text boxes that seamlessly integrate with the line design.


Plus, our plugin adapts to your workflow: automatically generate arrows by selecting elements, create them manually, or modify your existing arrows with a simple "Reset." Everything is designed to make your design process as smooth as possible.


Give it a try and see how this plugin can elevate your Figma workflow! We invite you to test it out and take your designs to the next level! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Crea tus flujos

108068.name: Flows Alicorp
108068.description:

plugins.name: Figma to Jitera Studio (Beta)
plugins.description:
Convert Figma designs to Jitera Studio with love.


How does it work

1) Install the plugin

2) In Figma hit cmd+/ and search "Figma to Jitera Studio" and hit enter

3) Select a layer you want to export


Limitations

Exporting designs to code are a best-effort process. Even getting 90% there can save you a ton of time, only having to clean up a few things.


If you find any issues or have feedback at all please contact us.

Features:

  • Generate realistic handwritten scribbles
  • Adjust scribble density, amplitude, and loop count


Use the Handwritten Scribe Generator to add a personal touch to your projects with hand-drawn elements.

plugins.name: Link Extractor
plugins.description:
Link Extractor lets you quickly find all hyperlinks in your design files.


Easily browse, then copy the links to where they're needed in your development process.


Functionality

  • Select one or many elements to extract all links contained within
  • Handles multiple links within a single text element
  • Displays the text body that is linked
  • Quickly select, copy, open or focus on any of the extracted URLs
plugins.tagline: Easily grab links out of your designs

44669.name: Link Extractor
44669.description:

Easily browse, then copy the links to where they're needed in your development process.


Functionality

  • Select one or many elements to extract all links contained within
  • Handles multiple links within a single text element
  • Displays the text body that is linked
  • Quickly select, copy, open or focus on any of the extracted URLs
44669.release_notes:
What's new
- Added controls to (1) focus your viewport on any of the links that were found and (2) open the link in a browser
- Added tags with the name of the frame that the link is contained within to help grouping of related links
- The plugin now immediately pulls out links from the current selection when opened, reducing the need for an extra click
44669.tagline: Easily grab links out of your designs

plugins.name: Tailwind boilerplate
plugins.description:
Features:

  • responsive font output if using mobile/desktop in the name of the font. EX: heading-1-desktop + heading-1-mobile. This will also work across folders
  • grabs all available font style values such as size, weight, line height, letter spacing, casing, and family.
  • output available in rem and px
  • easy copy paste contents directly into your tailwind.config.js and typography css file
  • customizable breakpoints (defaults to small screen size. See https://tailwindcss.com/docs/responsive-design)
  • outputs all saved color styles




View source code

plugins.name: Figma to Lob (Beta)
plugins.description:
CLOSED BETA - reach out to support@lob.com to be added!

Translate Figma documents into HTML templates for Lob!


Help Page


How to use

  1. Install the plugin
  2. Generate a template from an empty document with selected form factor and size using the "Create Template" button
  3. Design on top of the generated template
  4. For text merge variables, include a variable name enclosed in curly brackets IE {{first_name}}
  5. For image merge variables, enclose the image name in double curly brackets IE {{image_3}}
  6. Once your design is complete, run the plugin again.
  7. Select the desired form factor and size.
  8. Click "Export" at the bottom and save
  9. Unzip the newly created folder
  10. Host the images within the zip to a public url
  11. Open the HTML and modify the background-images to point to their respective public urls.


Hosting Images

You will need to host any assets in the "img" folder of your export. You will then need to reference them within your HTML template. See step 11 of "How to Use"


Disclaimer

Translating Figma into HTML is a best-effort process. Even getting 90% there can save you a ton of time, only having to clean up a few things.
plugins.tagline: Translate Figma documents into HTML templates for Lob!

134224.tagline: Translate Figma documents into HTML templates for Lob!

plugins.name: Export Figma variables
plugins.description:
Plugin exports variables to ts-code or css-code. Ts-code is especially useful if you use css-in-js libraries.


The plugin implies that you have base, semantic and component layers of variables. Component layer can use variables from other layers and reference on variables from its own layer. Semantic layer should only use variables from the base layer.


For example, base layer can have variables like color/blue/100, color/blue/200, color/red/100 for colors and space/100, space/100 for spacings and so on.


Semantic layer can have variables like color/primary, color/on-primary and so on. All variables should use variables from base layer.


Component layer must have variables grouped by components like button/color/text, button/color/bg, button/color/bg-hover, tooltip/color/text and so on. Top-level groups must be named by component names. These ones will be used for generating corresponding file names.


Usage


If you want to generate code for semantic layer you should specify only base collection. The component collection must be empty. The plugin generates two files: variables.css and variables.ts.


If you want to generate code for component layer you should specify base collection and component collection as well. In this case, plugin generates files only with ts-code.
plugins.tagline: A plugin for exporting figma variables to css and ts

97583.name: Export Figma variables
97583.description:

For example, base layer can have variables like color/blue/100, color/blue/200, color/red/100 for colors and space/100, space/100 for spacings and so on.


Semantic layer can have variables like color/primary, color/on-primary and so on. All variables should use variables from base layer.


Component layer must have variables grouped by components like button/color/text, button/color/bg, button/color/bg-hover, tooltip/color/text and so on. Top-level groups must be named by component names. These ones will be used for generating corresponding file names.


Usage


If you want to generate code for semantic layer you should specify only base collection. The component collection must be empty. The plugin generates two files: variables.css and variables.ts.


If you want to generate code for component layer you should specify base collection and component collection as well. In this case, plugin generates files only with ts-code.

plugins.name: Delete Any Layer
plugins.description:
Say goodbye to tedious deletion tasks and hello to efficiency with Delete Any Layer, a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your workflow.


This plugin empowers you to effortlessly delete all items (including hidden and locked) within a selected region. Simply follow these steps:


  1. Select the target region: Define the area where you want to delete items. This could be a freehand selection or an already existing frame or group.
  2. Type the item name: Enter the name of the element you want to remove.
  3. Witness the magic: Select Type Delete instantly identifies and removes all matching items within the chosen region.


Benefits:

  1. Unmatched precision: Say goodbye to accidental deletions! The plugin only removes items with the exact name you specify.
  2. Effortless batch deletion: No more manually selecting and deleting items one by one. This plugin handles it all with ease.
  3. Enhanced efficiency: Save valuable time and effort, allowing you to tackle projects faster than ever before.
plugins.tagline: Delete visible, hidden and locked layers with a click!

This is my first plugin so feedback is much appreciated!

plugins.name: Alignmate - Organize Your Layers
plugins.description:
Alignmate allows you to effortlessly organize selected elements in your Figma designs, making your layouts neat, consistent, and visually appealing.


Key features include:


  1. Arrange items in a grid, horizontal, or vertical layout.
  2. Customize spacing between elements to fit your design needs.
  3. Scale items uniformly to maintain a consistent look.
  4. Simple, intuitive interface for quick and easy organization.
  5. Perfect for aligning frames, icons, mood-boards, and other design elements without leaving Figma.


How to use:


  1. Open the plugin.
  2. Select the layers you want to arrange (up to 200 layers).
  3. Choose your preferred layout type and set your desired spacing.


Streamline your workflow and achieve a polished design layout with ease!


👉🏼 Contact me here
plugins.tagline: Keep your designs neat, consistent, and visually appealing.

plugins.name: Visible Property 2
plugins.description:
Visible Property 2 will help you creating documentation for hand off. It will update label following reference's component whenever you call the plugin.


Video Tutorial


https://youtu.be/NoihOB1Z6qM


✨ Quick start:


Select "Generate All Color Styles" in plugin menu. Plugin will create Pantone for all of your Color styles


🐷 How it works:


  1. Define reference element by adding "#" in front of a layer name. For example, "#color"
  2. Defile text element you want to update (#reference + . + method). For example, "#color.fill", "#color.fillRGB", "#color.height" etc.
  3. Call the plugin by typing "cmd + /" -> "visible property 2"


🐯 Tips


You can refer to the parent layer by using "##Parent" or "##TopParent" without inserting a layer name.

For example,

  • ##Parent.name or ##Parent.fill
  • ##TopParent.name or ##TopParent.fill


🦁 Properties:


Fill

  • fill -> #123456 78%
  • fillRGB -> rgba(123, 456, 789, 1)
  • fillHSL -> hsla(123, 456, 789, 0.1)
  • fillHSB -> hsba(123, 456, 789, 0.1)
  • fillStyle -> DarkBlue
  • fillStyleDescription -> The Description


Stroke

  • stroke -> #123456
  • strokeRGB -> rgba(123, 456, 789, 1)
  • strokeHSL -> hsla(123, 456, 789, 0.1)
  • strokeHSB -> hsba(123, 456, 789, 0.1)
  • strokeStyle -> DarkBlue
  • strokeStyleDescription -> The Description


Text

  • font -> Roboto
  • fontWeight -> Bold
  • fontSize -> 12
  • paragraphIndent -> 12
  • paragraphSpace -> 12
  • letterSpace -> 12 or 12%
  • lineHeight -> 12 or 12%
  • textStyle -> Body
  • textStyleDescription -> The Description


Size

  • height -> 32
  • width -> 64


Layer

  • name -> layer name


Component

  • description -> component description


Note: This plugin only supports gradients with default Start/Stop positions


☕️ Love this plugin: buy me a coffee


This plugin is an open-source on github
plugins.tagline: Plugin will help you update text follow component property.

88254.name: Visible Property 2
88254.description:
Visible Property 2 will help you creating documentation for hand off. It will update label following reference's component whenever you call the plugin.


Video Tutorial


https://youtu.be/NoihOB1Z6qM


✨ Quick start:


Select "Generate All Color Styles" in plugin menu. Plugin will create Pantone for all of your Color styles


🐷 How it works:


  1. Define reference element by adding "#" in front of a layer name. For example, "#color"
  2. Defile text element you want to update (#reference + . + method). For example, "#color.fill", "#color.fillRGB", "#color.height" etc.
  3. Call the plugin by typing "cmd + /" -> "visible property 2"


🐯 Tips


You can refer to the parent layer by using "##Parent" or "##TopParent" without inserting a layer name.

For example,

  • ##Parent.name or ##Parent.fill
  • ##TopParent.name or ##TopParent.fill


🦁 Properties:


Fill

  • fill -> #123456 78%
  • fillRGB -> rgba(123, 456, 789, 1)
  • fillHSL -> hsla(123, 456, 789, 0.1)
  • fillHSB -> hsba(123, 456, 789, 0.1)
  • fillStyle -> DarkBlue
  • fillStyleDescription -> The Description


Stroke

  • stroke -> #123456
  • strokeRGB -> rgba(123, 456, 789, 1)
  • strokeHSL -> hsla(123, 456, 789, 0.1)
  • strokeHSB -> hsba(123, 456, 789, 0.1)
  • strokeStyle -> DarkBlue
  • strokeStyleDescription -> The Description


Text

  • font -> Roboto
  • fontWeight -> Bold
  • fontSize -> 12
  • paragraphIndent -> 12
  • paragraphSpace -> 12
  • letterSpace -> 12 or 12%
  • lineHeight -> 12 or 12%
  • textStyle -> Body
  • textStyleDescription -> The Description


Size

  • height -> 32
  • width -> 64


Layer

  • name -> layer name


Component

  • description -> component description


Note: This plugin only supports gradients with default Start/Stop positions


☕️ Love this plugin: buy me a coffee


This plugin is an open-source on github
88254.tagline: Plugin will help you update text follow component property.

plugins.name: Magnifier
plugins.description:
Similar plugin: Draw a shape and create the pixelated censor effect


Features

  1. Zoom level from 1x to 5x
  2. Circle or rectangle shape
  3. Stroke color
  4. Corner radius


How to Use

  1. Draw/Place a rectangle over the area you want to magnify, then click "Apply"
  2. Adjust zoom levels, shapes, and other styles, then click "Update"
  3. Select "magnifier_group" at any time to make further updates


Use Cases

  1. Highlighting product features
  2. Explaining step-by-step processes in training materials
  3. Showcasing portfolios and marketing visuals


Pricing

  1. Enjoy 5 free uses with full access to all features.
  2. Unlock unlimited access with free future updates for a one-time purchase.


Tips

  1. After applying the magnifier effect, a group called "magnifier_group" is created. The group layer has a drop shadow effect, which you can adjust in the Design panel.
  2. Within the group, a "magnifier_shape" is created, that has a drop shadow effect for the white glowing effect inside the magnifier, and a stroke for the thickness of the magnifier, which you can adjust in the Design panel.
  3. Make sure the group and its children's names remain unchanged if you want to update it later.


Transform your designs with the magnifier effect, try it today!


Credit: Preview mobile screens by DI_Designing
plugins.tagline: Create magnifier effect to showcase your design

plugins.name: RGB Color Picker:
plugins.description:
A color wheel is a circular representation of colors, typically made up of 12 hues. It's a fundamental tool in many fields like art, design, and printing, as it helps us understand how colors relate to each other.


RYB (Red, Yellow, Blue): This is the traditional painters' color wheel used for mixing physical paints.


RGB (Red, Green, Blue): This is the color model used for displays like TVs and computer screens.


CMYK (Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Black): This is the color model used for printing.

accepted.name: Color Creator
accepted.description:
This page would be your one-stop shop for all things UI/UX creativity and a treasure trove of tools to elevate your designs.

www.beforepost.com

plugins.tagline: RGB: The language of color. Speak it fluently.

plugins.name: Variables Documentation
plugins.description:
Variables Documentation

Document your design system variables with clarity and precision. This plugin creates comprehensive, customizable documentation for Figma variables, making your design tokens accessible and shareable.


Key Features


  1. Generate professional tables showing variable values across all modes
  2. Visualize colors with swatches, hex codes, and transparency
  3. Track variable relationships with clear alias references and resolved values
  4. Filter and search through large variable collections easily
  5. Choose between multiple display styles and customization options
  6. Customize table appearance with company branding
  7. Preserve variable hierarchy in organized documentation
  8. Handle large design systems efficiently with optimized performance


Simple Workflow


  1. Select your variable collection
  2. Choose variables to document
  3. Customize display settings
  4. Generate your documentation
  5. Share with your team


Perfect for design system teams, documentation specialists, and designers who need to communicate design tokens clearly. Save time and maintain consistency with automated variable documentation.
plugins.tagline: Create beautiful documentation tables for all your Figma variables

plugins.name: Context Switch
plugins.description:
Manage content writing across your team’s product with multiple state using Google Sheets and Airtable.


Context Switch lets people maintain the texting outside the Figma files and directly import the context into the text elements that need to update.


With Context Switch, your team can even maintain multiple state: internationalization: EN 🇺🇸, JP 🇯🇵, TW 🇹🇼... / condition: Normal 🙂, Deep Dive 👩🏻‍💻... at once! and the best of all, Designer control "when" to update the content and don't need to update content manually, plugin helps you do the works!

---

📌 We are still in alpha version, so be careful using it.

📌Support Image switching are on the roadmap.

📝 Setup Note: https://www.notion.so/Figma-Plugin-Context-Switch-Note-a6fe123a69474646b1be29123fb6703a

📧 Email me for any question: me@designtips.today
plugins.tagline: Manage content writing across your team’s product with multiple state using Google Sheets.

plugins.name: Knob Maker
plugins.description:
How to use:


1. Create Frame

2. Frame should contain at least two children: "Center" and "Rotating Pointer"

3. Open KnobMaker Plugin -> Specify #frames and #degrees


Feel free to checkout Github repo.


Submit issues and feature requests using GH repo.


Video instruction

plugins.name: Respresso
plugins.description:
Integration plugin for respresso (https://respresso.io/), which is a collaborative asset management tool for multiplatform projects. You can send your digital assets (texts, images, colors, app icons) into Respresso with a single click.

Please read our documentation before you export assets from Figma: https://github.com/pontehu/respresso-figma

Respresso is free for the time beign and we don't want to change this offer in short time :) Don't waste your time! Use Respresso.
